trans-unit.source: ms.assetid: 54973C62-9669-4988-934E-9273FB0425FD title: Enable your device for development description: There is a different approach for development for Windows 10 devices.
trans-unit.target: ms.assetid: 54973C62-9669-4988-934E-9273FB0425FD title: Enable your device for development description: There is a different approach for development for Windows 10 devices.

trans-unit.source: keywords: Get started keywords: Developer license keywords: Visual Studio, developer license keywords: enable device
trans-unit.target: keywords: Get started keywords: Developer license keywords: Visual Studio, developer license keywords: enable device

trans-unit.source: Enable your device for development
trans-unit.target: Enable your device for development

trans-unit.source: There is a different approach for development for Windows 10 devices.
trans-unit.target: There is a different approach for development for Windows 10 devices.

trans-unit.source: A developer license is no longer required for each device that you want to use to develop, install or test your app.
trans-unit.target: A developer license is no longer required for each device that you want to use to develop, install or test your app.

trans-unit.source: You just enable a device once for these tasks from the settings for the device.
trans-unit.target: You just enable a device once for these tasks from the settings for the device.

trans-unit.source: That's it.
trans-unit.target: That's it.

trans-unit.source: No more renewing your developer licenses every 30 or 90 days!
trans-unit.target: No more renewing your developer licenses every 30 or 90 days!

trans-unit.source: If you are still using a Windows 8.1 device to develop or test your apps with Microsoft Visual Studio 2013 or Microsoft Visual Studio 2015, you still need to [get a developer license](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh974578) or [register your Windows Phone](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn614128).
trans-unit.target: If you are still using a Windows 8.1 device to develop or test your apps with Microsoft Visual Studio 2013 or Microsoft Visual Studio 2015, you still need to [get a developer license](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh974578) or [register your Windows Phone](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn614128).

trans-unit.source: Use developer features
trans-unit.target: Use developer features

trans-unit.source: Develop your app with Microsoft Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Develop your app with Microsoft Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: If you use Microsoft Visual Studio on a Windows 10 device and you open a solution for a Windows 8.1 or Windows 10 app, you are prompted to enable your device with this dialog.
trans-unit.target: If you use Microsoft Visual Studio on a Windows 10 device and you open a solution for a Windows 8.1 or Windows 10 app, you are prompted to enable your device with this dialog.

trans-unit.source: You need your device to be enabled to use the designers and debug your app.
trans-unit.target: You need your device to be enabled to use the designers and debug your app.

trans-unit.source: Enable developer mode dialog that is displayed in Visual Studio](images/latestenabledialog.png) When you see this dialog, click **settings for developers** to go directly to the **Update & security** page as shown below.
trans-unit.target: Enable developer mode dialog that is displayed in Visual Studio](images/latestenabledialog.png) When you see this dialog, click **settings for developers** to go directly to the **Update & security** page as shown below.

trans-unit.source: Or click **OK** and then follow the steps below to enable your Windows 10 device for development.
trans-unit.target: Or click **OK** and then follow the steps below to enable your Windows 10 device for development.

trans-unit.source: Enable your Windows 10 devices
trans-unit.target: Enable your Windows 10 devices

trans-unit.source: For Windows 10, you choose the developer features you want to enable on the device.
trans-unit.target: For Windows 10, you choose the developer features you want to enable on the device.

trans-unit.source: This includes any devices: Windows 10 desktops, tablets and phones.
trans-unit.target: This includes any devices: Windows 10 desktops, tablets and phones.

trans-unit.source: You can enable a device for development, or just for sideloading.
trans-unit.target: You can enable a device for development, or just for sideloading.

trans-unit.source: *Sideloading* is installing and then running or testing an app that has not been certified by the Windows Store.
trans-unit.target: *Sideloading* is installing and then running or testing an app that has not been certified by the Windows Store.

trans-unit.source: For example, an app that is internal to your company only.
trans-unit.target: For example, an app that is internal to your company only.

trans-unit.source: *Developer mode* lets you sideload apps, and also run apps from Visual Studio in debug mode.
trans-unit.target: *Developer mode* lets you sideload apps, and also run apps from Visual Studio in debug mode.

trans-unit.source: **Note** If you sideload apps, you should still only install apps from trusted sources.
trans-unit.target: **Note** If you sideload apps, you should still only install apps from trusted sources.

trans-unit.source: When you install a sideloaded app that has not been certified by the Windows Store, you are agreeing that you have obtained all rights necessary to sideload the app and that you are solely responsible for any harm that results from installing and running the app.
trans-unit.target: When you install a sideloaded app that has not been certified by the Windows Store, you are agreeing that you have obtained all rights necessary to sideload the app and that you are solely responsible for any harm that results from installing and running the app.

trans-unit.source: See the Windows > Windows Store section of this [privacy statement](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=521839).
trans-unit.target: See the Windows > Windows Store section of this [privacy statement](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=521839).

trans-unit.source: To use developer features
trans-unit.target: To use developer features

trans-unit.source: On your device that you want to enable, go to **Settings**.
trans-unit.target: On your device that you want to enable, go to **Settings**.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Update & security**, then choose **For developers**.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Update & security**, then choose **For developers**.

trans-unit.source: Choose the level of access that you need.
trans-unit.target: Choose the level of access that you need.

trans-unit.source: For more detailed info about the options, see [Which settings should I choose: sideload apps or developer mode?](#WhichSettings)
trans-unit.target: For more detailed info about the options, see [Which settings should I choose: sideload apps or developer mode?](#WhichSettings)

trans-unit.source: Read the disclaimer for the setting you chose, then click **Yes** to accept the change.
trans-unit.target: Read the disclaimer for the setting you chose, then click **Yes** to accept the change.

trans-unit.source: Here's the settings page on the desktop device family.
trans-unit.target: Here's the settings page on the desktop device family.

trans-unit.source: Go to Settings, choose Update and security and then choose For developers to view your options
trans-unit.target: Go to Settings, choose Update and security and then choose For developers to view your options

trans-unit.source: Here's the settings page on the mobile device family.
trans-unit.target: Here's the settings page on the mobile device family.

trans-unit.source: From Settings on your phone, choose Update and security
trans-unit.target: From Settings on your phone, choose Update and security

trans-unit.source: Which settings should I choose: sideload apps or developer mode?
trans-unit.target: Which settings should I choose: sideload apps or developer mode?

trans-unit.source: By default, you can only install Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps from the Windows Store.
trans-unit.target: By default, you can only install Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps from the Windows Store.

trans-unit.source: Changing these settings to use developer features can change the level of security of your device.
trans-unit.target: Changing these settings to use developer features can change the level of security of your device.

trans-unit.source: You should not install apps from unverified sources.
trans-unit.target: You should not install apps from unverified sources.

trans-unit.source: Sideload apps
trans-unit.target: Sideload apps

trans-unit.source: The Sideload apps setting is typically used by companies or schools that need to install custom apps on managed devices without going through the Windows Store.
trans-unit.target: The Sideload apps setting is typically used by companies or schools that need to install custom apps on managed devices without going through the Windows Store.

trans-unit.source: In this case, it's common for the organization to enforce a policy that disables the *Windows Store apps* setting, as shown previously in the image of the phone settings page.
trans-unit.target: In this case, it's common for the organization to enforce a policy that disables the *Windows Store apps* setting, as shown previously in the image of the phone settings page.

trans-unit.source: The organization also provides the required certificate and install location to sideload apps.
trans-unit.target: The organization also provides the required certificate and install location to sideload apps.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see the TechNet articles [Sideload apps in Windows 10](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/mt269549.aspx) and [Get started with app deployment in Microsoft Intune](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn646955.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see the TechNet articles [Sideload apps in Windows 10](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/mt269549.aspx) and [Get started with app deployment in Microsoft Intune](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn646955.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Device family specific info
trans-unit.target: Device family specific info

trans-unit.source: On the desktop device family: You can install an app package (.appx) and any certificate that is needed to run the app by running the Windows PowerShell script that is created with the package ("Add-AppDevPackage.ps1").
trans-unit.target: On the desktop device family: You can install an app package (.appx) and any certificate that is needed to run the app by running the Windows PowerShell script that is created with the package ("Add-AppDevPackage.ps1").

trans-unit.source: On the mobile device family: If the required certificate is already installed, you can tap the file to install any .appx sent to you via email or on an SD card.
trans-unit.target: On the mobile device family: If the required certificate is already installed, you can tap the file to install any .appx sent to you via email or on an SD card.

trans-unit.source: **Sideload apps** is a more secure option than Developer mode because you cannot install apps on the device without a trusted certificate.
trans-unit.target: **Sideload apps** is a more secure option than Developer mode because you cannot install apps on the device without a trusted certificate.

trans-unit.source: Developer mode
trans-unit.target: Developer mode

trans-unit.source: In addition to sideloading, the Developer mode setting enables debugging and additional deployment options.
trans-unit.target: In addition to sideloading, the Developer mode setting enables debugging and additional deployment options.

trans-unit.source: It replaces the Windows 8.1 requirement for a developer license.
trans-unit.target: It replaces the Windows 8.1 requirement for a developer license.

trans-unit.source: Device family specific info
trans-unit.target: Device family specific info

trans-unit.source: On the desktop device family:
trans-unit.target: On the desktop device family:

trans-unit.source: Enable Developer mode to develop and debug apps in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Enable Developer mode to develop and debug apps in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: As stated previously, you will be prompted in Visual Studio if Developer mode is not enabled.
trans-unit.target: As stated previously, you will be prompted in Visual Studio if Developer mode is not enabled.

trans-unit.source: On the mobile device family:
trans-unit.target: On the mobile device family:

trans-unit.source: Enable developer mode to deploy apps from Visual Studio and debug them on the device.
trans-unit.target: Enable developer mode to deploy apps from Visual Studio and debug them on the device.

trans-unit.source: You can tap the file to install any .appx sent to you via email or on an SD card.
trans-unit.target: You can tap the file to install any .appx sent to you via email or on an SD card.

trans-unit.source: Do not install apps from unverified sources.
trans-unit.target: Do not install apps from unverified sources.

trans-unit.source: Tip
trans-unit.target: Tip

trans-unit.source: There are several tools you can use to deploy an app from a Windows 10 PC to a Windows 10 mobile device.
trans-unit.target: There are several tools you can use to deploy an app from a Windows 10 PC to a Windows 10 mobile device.

trans-unit.source: Both devices must be connected to the same subnet of the network by a wired or wireless connection, or they must be connected by USB.
trans-unit.target: Both devices must be connected to the same subnet of the network by a wired or wireless connection, or they must be connected by USB.

trans-unit.source: Either of the ways listed installs only the app package (.appx); they do not install certificates.
trans-unit.target: Either of the ways listed installs only the app package (.appx); they do not install certificates.

trans-unit.source: Use the Windows 10 Application Deployment (WinAppDeployCmd) tool.
trans-unit.target: Use the Windows 10 Application Deployment (WinAppDeployCmd) tool.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about [the WinAppDeployCmd tool](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt203806.aspx).
trans-unit.target: Learn more about [the WinAppDeployCmd tool](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt203806.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Starting in Windows 10, Version 1511, you can use [Device Portal](#device_portal) to deploy from your browser to a mobile device running Windows 10, Version 1511 or later.
trans-unit.target: Starting in Windows 10, Version 1511, you can use [Device Portal](#device_portal) to deploy from your browser to a mobile device running Windows 10, Version 1511 or later.

trans-unit.source: Use the **Apps** page in Device Portal (<IP>/appmanager.md) to upload an app package (.appx) and install it on the device.
trans-unit.target: Use the **Apps** page in Device Portal (<IP>/appmanager.md) to upload an app package (.appx) and install it on the device.

trans-unit.source: Set group policies or registry keys
trans-unit.target: Set group policies or registry keys

trans-unit.source: You can also use group policies or registry keys as an alternative way to enable your Windows 10 desktop device for development.
trans-unit.target: You can also use group policies or registry keys as an alternative way to enable your Windows 10 desktop device for development.

trans-unit.source: On the desktop device family
trans-unit.target: On the desktop device family

trans-unit.source: Use gpedit.msc to set the group policies to enable your device, unless you have Windows 10 Home.
trans-unit.target: Use gpedit.msc to set the group policies to enable your device, unless you have Windows 10 Home.

trans-unit.source: If you do have Windows 10 Home, you need to use regedit or PowerShell commands to set the registry keys directly to enable your device.
trans-unit.target: If you do have Windows 10 Home, you need to use regedit or PowerShell commands to set the registry keys directly to enable your device.

trans-unit.source: Use gpedit to enable your device
trans-unit.target: Use gpedit to enable your device

trans-unit.source: Run **Gpedit.msc**.
trans-unit.target: Run **Gpedit.msc**.

trans-unit.source: Go to Local Computer Policy > Computer Configuration > Administrative Templates > Windows Components > App Package Deployment
trans-unit.target: Go to Local Computer Policy > Computer Configuration > Administrative Templates > Windows Components > App Package Deployment

trans-unit.source: To enable sideloading, edit the policies to enable:
trans-unit.target: To enable sideloading, edit the policies to enable:

trans-unit.source: Allow all trusted apps to install
trans-unit.target: Allow all trusted apps to install

trans-unit.source: OR -
trans-unit.target: OR -

trans-unit.source: To enable developer mode, edit the policies to enable both:
trans-unit.target: To enable developer mode, edit the policies to enable both:

trans-unit.source: Allow all trusted apps to install
trans-unit.target: Allow all trusted apps to install

trans-unit.source: Allows development of Windows Store apps and installing them from an integrated development environment (IDE)
trans-unit.target: Allows development of Windows Store apps and installing them from an integrated development environment (IDE)

trans-unit.source: Reboot your machine.
trans-unit.target: Reboot your machine.

trans-unit.source: Use regedit to enable your device
trans-unit.target: Use regedit to enable your device

trans-unit.source: Run **regedit**.
trans-unit.target: Run **regedit**.

trans-unit.source: To enable sideloading, set the value of this DWORD to 1:
trans-unit.target: To enable sideloading, set the value of this DWORD to 1:

trans-unit.source: HKLM\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows\\CurrentVersion\\AppModelUnlock\\AllowAllTrustedApps
trans-unit.target: HKLM\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows\\CurrentVersion\\AppModelUnlock\\AllowAllTrustedApps

trans-unit.source: OR -
trans-unit.target: OR -

trans-unit.source: To enable developer mode, set the values of this DWORD to 1:
trans-unit.target: To enable developer mode, set the values of this DWORD to 1:

trans-unit.source: HKLM\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows\\CurrentVersion\\AppModelUnlock\\AllowDevelopmentWithoutDevLicense
trans-unit.target: HKLM\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows\\CurrentVersion\\AppModelUnlock\\AllowDevelopmentWithoutDevLicense

trans-unit.source: Use PowerShell to enable your device
trans-unit.target: Use PowerShell to enable your device

trans-unit.source: Run PowerShell with administrator privileges.
trans-unit.target: Run PowerShell with administrator privileges.

trans-unit.source: To enable sideloading, run this command:
trans-unit.target: To enable sideloading, run this command:

trans-unit.source: PS C:\\WINDOWS\\system32> reg add "HKEY\_LOCAL\_MACHINE\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows\\CurrentVersion\\AppModelUnlock" /t REG\_DWORD /f /v "AllowAllTrustedApps" /d "1"
trans-unit.target: PS C:\\WINDOWS\\system32> reg add "HKEY\_LOCAL\_MACHINE\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows\\CurrentVersion\\AppModelUnlock" /t REG\_DWORD /f /v "AllowAllTrustedApps" /d "1"

trans-unit.source: OR -
trans-unit.target: OR -

trans-unit.source: To enable developer mode, run this command:
trans-unit.target: To enable developer mode, run this command:

trans-unit.source: PS C:\\WINDOWS\\system32> reg add "HKEY\_LOCAL\_MACHINE\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows\\CurrentVersion\\AppModelUnlock" /t REG\_DWORD /f /v "AllowDevelopmentWithoutDevLicense" /d "1"
trans-unit.target: PS C:\\WINDOWS\\system32> reg add "HKEY\_LOCAL\_MACHINE\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows\\CurrentVersion\\AppModelUnlock" /t REG\_DWORD /f /v "AllowDevelopmentWithoutDevLicense" /d "1"

trans-unit.source: Developer features for mobile devices
trans-unit.target: Developer features for mobile devices

trans-unit.source: Starting in Windows 10, Version 1511, additional developer features are available for the mobile device family.
trans-unit.target: Starting in Windows 10, Version 1511, additional developer features are available for the mobile device family.

trans-unit.source: These features are available only when **Developer mode** is enabled on the device.
trans-unit.target: These features are available only when **Developer mode** is enabled on the device.

trans-unit.source: Developer mode options for mobile devices
trans-unit.target: Developer mode options for mobile devices

trans-unit.source: Device discovery and pairing
trans-unit.target: Device discovery and pairing

trans-unit.source: (Windows 10, Version 1511 or later, mobile device family only)
trans-unit.target: (Windows 10, Version 1511 or later, mobile device family only)

trans-unit.source: To connect to Device Portal, you must enable Device discovery.
trans-unit.target: To connect to Device Portal, you must enable Device discovery.

trans-unit.source: This lets you pair your phone with a PC or other Windows 10 device.
trans-unit.target: This lets you pair your phone with a PC or other Windows 10 device.

trans-unit.source: Both devices must be connected to the same subnet of the network by a wired or wireless connection, or they must be connected by USB.
trans-unit.target: Both devices must be connected to the same subnet of the network by a wired or wireless connection, or they must be connected by USB.

trans-unit.source: The first time you connect to Device Portal, you are asked for a case-sensitive, 6 character security code.
trans-unit.target: The first time you connect to Device Portal, you are asked for a case-sensitive, 6 character security code.

trans-unit.source: This ensures that you have access to the phone, and keeps you safe from attackers.
trans-unit.target: This ensures that you have access to the phone, and keeps you safe from attackers.

trans-unit.source: Press the **Pair** button on your phone to generate and display the code, then enter the 6 characters into the text box in the browser.
trans-unit.target: Press the **Pair** button on your phone to generate and display the code, then enter the 6 characters into the text box in the browser.

trans-unit.source: Developer mode device discovery settings
trans-unit.target: Developer mode device discovery settings

trans-unit.source: Device Portal
trans-unit.target: Device Portal

trans-unit.source: (Windows 10, Version 1511 or later, mobile device family only)
trans-unit.target: (Windows 10, Version 1511 or later, mobile device family only)

trans-unit.source: Device Portal lets you view diagnostic info and interact with your phone over HTTP from your browser.
trans-unit.target: Device Portal lets you view diagnostic info and interact with your phone over HTTP from your browser.

trans-unit.source: You can use Device Portal to do the following:
trans-unit.target: You can use Device Portal to do the following:

trans-unit.source: See a list of processes running on the phone
trans-unit.target: See a list of processes running on the phone

trans-unit.source: Install, delete, launch, and terminate apps on your phone
trans-unit.target: Install, delete, launch, and terminate apps on your phone

trans-unit.source: Change Wi-Fi profiles and view signal strength (ipconfig)
trans-unit.target: Change Wi-Fi profiles and view signal strength (ipconfig)

trans-unit.source: View live graphs of CPU, memory, I/O, network, and GPU usage
trans-unit.target: View live graphs of CPU, memory, I/O, network, and GPU usage

trans-unit.source: Shutdown your phone
trans-unit.target: Shutdown your phone

trans-unit.source: This image shows the **Performance** page of Device Portal running locally in the phone's browser.
trans-unit.target: This image shows the **Performance** page of Device Portal running locally in the phone's browser.

trans-unit.source: Device Portal running on the phone
trans-unit.target: Device Portal running on the phone

trans-unit.source: You can choose from 3 ways to connect to Device Portal: USB, local host, and over the local network (including VPN and tethering).
trans-unit.target: You can choose from 3 ways to connect to Device Portal: USB, local host, and over the local network (including VPN and tethering).

trans-unit.source: To connect to Device Portal
trans-unit.target: To connect to Device Portal

trans-unit.source: In your browser, enter the address shown here for the connection type you're using.
trans-unit.target: In your browser, enter the address shown here for the connection type you're using.

trans-unit.source: Use this address when the phone is connected to a PC via a USB connection.
trans-unit.target: Use this address when the phone is connected to a PC via a USB connection.

trans-unit.source: Both devices must have Windows 10, Version 1511 or later.
trans-unit.target: Both devices must have Windows 10, Version 1511 or later.

trans-unit.source: Localhost: http://127.0.0.1
trans-unit.target: Localhost: http://127.0.0.1

trans-unit.source: Use this address to view Device Portal locally on the phone in Microsoft Edge for Windows 10 Mobile.
trans-unit.target: Use this address to view Device Portal locally on the phone in Microsoft Edge for Windows 10 Mobile.

trans-unit.source: Local Network: https://*<The IP address of the phone>*
trans-unit.target: Local Network: https://*<The IP address of the phone>*

trans-unit.source: Use this address to connect over a local network.
trans-unit.target: Use this address to connect over a local network.

trans-unit.source: The IP address of the phone is shown in the Device Portal settings on the phone.
trans-unit.target: The IP address of the phone is shown in the Device Portal settings on the phone.

trans-unit.source: HTTPS is required for authentication and secure communication.
trans-unit.target: HTTPS is required for authentication and secure communication.

trans-unit.source: Press the **Pair** button on your phone to generate and display the required security code
trans-unit.target: Press the **Pair** button on your phone to generate and display the required security code

trans-unit.source: Enter the 6 character security code into the Device Portal password box in your browser.
trans-unit.target: Enter the 6 character security code into the Device Portal password box in your browser.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) Check the **Remember my computer** box in your browser to remember this pairing in the future.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) Check the **Remember my computer** box in your browser to remember this pairing in the future.

trans-unit.source: Here's the Device Portal section of the developer settings page on Windows Phone.
trans-unit.target: Here's the Device Portal section of the developer settings page on Windows Phone.

trans-unit.source: Device Portal settings
trans-unit.target: Device Portal settings

trans-unit.source: If you are using Device Portal in a protected environment, like a test lab, where you trust everyone on your local network, have no personal information on the device, and have unique requirements, you can disable authentication.
trans-unit.target: If you are using Device Portal in a protected environment, like a test lab, where you trust everyone on your local network, have no personal information on the device, and have unique requirements, you can disable authentication.

trans-unit.source: This enables unencrypted communication, and allows anyone with the IP address of your phone to control it.
trans-unit.target: This enables unencrypted communication, and allows anyone with the IP address of your phone to control it.

trans-unit.source: Error reporting
trans-unit.target: Error reporting

trans-unit.source: (Windows 10, Version 1511 or later, mobile device family only)
trans-unit.target: (Windows 10, Version 1511 or later, mobile device family only)

trans-unit.source: Set this value to specify how many crash dumps are saved on your phone.
trans-unit.target: Set this value to specify how many crash dumps are saved on your phone.

trans-unit.source: Collecting crash dumps on your phone gives you instant access to important crash information directly after the crash occurs.
trans-unit.target: Collecting crash dumps on your phone gives you instant access to important crash information directly after the crash occurs.

trans-unit.source: Dumps are collected for developer-signed apps only.
trans-unit.target: Dumps are collected for developer-signed apps only.

trans-unit.source: You can find the dumps in your phone's storage in the Documents\\Debug folder.
trans-unit.target: You can find the dumps in your phone's storage in the Documents\\Debug folder.

trans-unit.source: For more info about dump files, see [Using dump files](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/d5zhxt22.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more info about dump files, see [Using dump files](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/d5zhxt22.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Upgrading your device from Windows 8.1 to Windows 10
trans-unit.target: Upgrading your device from Windows 8.1 to Windows 10

trans-unit.source: When you create or sideload apps on your Windows 8.1 device, you have to install a developer license.
trans-unit.target: When you create or sideload apps on your Windows 8.1 device, you have to install a developer license.

trans-unit.source: If you upgrade your device from Windows 8.1 to Windows 10, this information remains.
trans-unit.target: If you upgrade your device from Windows 8.1 to Windows 10, this information remains.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to remove this information from your upgraded Windows 10 device.
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to remove this information from your upgraded Windows 10 device.

trans-unit.source: This step is not required if you upgrade directly from Windows 8.1 to Windows 10, Version 1511 or later.
trans-unit.target: This step is not required if you upgrade directly from Windows 8.1 to Windows 10, Version 1511 or later.

trans-unit.source: To unregister a developer license
trans-unit.target: To unregister a developer license

trans-unit.source: Run PowerShell with administrator privileges.
trans-unit.target: Run PowerShell with administrator privileges.

trans-unit.source: Run this command: **unregister-windowsdeveloperlicense**.
trans-unit.target: Run this command: **unregister-windowsdeveloperlicense**.

trans-unit.source: After this you need to enable your device for development as described in this topic so that you can continue to develop on this device.
trans-unit.target: After this you need to enable your device for development as described in this topic so that you can continue to develop on this device.

trans-unit.source: If you don't do that, you might get an error when you debug your app, or you try to create a package for it.
trans-unit.target: If you don't do that, you might get an error when you debug your app, or you try to create a package for it.

trans-unit.source: Here is an example of this error:
trans-unit.target: Here is an example of this error:

trans-unit.source: Error : DEP0700 : Registration of the app failed.
trans-unit.target: Error : DEP0700 : Registration of the app failed.
